Authors: Marie Bartikova, Ludmila Holkova, Ivana Safrankova
Title:
Genetic clades determination of Calonectria pseudonaviculata,
causing boxwood blight in the Czech Republic
Keywords:
Buxus, phylogenetic determination, Calonectria
henricotiae, Cylindrocladium buxicola, NotI
Abstract:
The first occurrence of boxwood blight in 2010 in the
Czech Republic was on young plants in a plant production nursery. Since
then, the disease has occurred on imported plants and in recent years,
also on older plants in chateau gardens and parks. At present, the
existence of two genotypes of Calonectria pseudonaviculata is known on
the European continent. Preventive measures are often not sufficient to
control this disease, therefore chemical management needs to be
included. It is important to distinguish the genetic clades for targeted
chemical control. We have focused on phylogenetic determination of four
isolates of Calonectria pseudonaviculata collected from chateau gardens
in the Czech Republic by sequencing and phylogenetic analysis. It was
possible to determine both phylogenetic species within the betaÂ–tubulin
gene sequence. Showing presence of both phylogenetical species in the
Czech Republic with the dominating clade Calonectria henricotiae. This
statement was supported by term tolerance tests on mycelia growth of
both clades.
